oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.customization.uiPublic.utils
Class NavMenuUpdateMetadataObjectNS

java.lang.Object
  oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.customization.uiPublic.utils.NavMenuUpdateMetadataObjectNS

public class NavMenuUpdateMetadataObjectNS
extends java.lang.Object

Refer bug report - 14189902 - RUP4 MLR3:BRE WHILE INSERTING NEW NODE BELOW A PREVIOUSLY INSETED NODE IN FSM. While ATG implemented NavMenuCustomPageBean.processNavigationMenuProperties() which takes care of creating a group or and item node, method Document.createElement() was used as opposed to Document.createElementNS(). This resulted in creating new customization inserts in absent namespace. Hence all the generated customization instructions related to inserts by processNavigationMenuProperties() ( from Nov 2009) will be invalid. Schema validation warning that gets raised while performing mdsSession.flushChanges() might be overlooked by ATG since Oracle BALI library raises warning for this issue rather than a validation error. Gordon's team corrected NavMenuCustomPageBean.processNavigationMenuProperties() to use Document.createElementNS() in their code. This correction will ensure the newly generated customization instructions are valid. NavMenuUpdateMetadataObjectNS.fix() static method will correct the invalid customization instructions (if present) in existing tip-layer customization document (generated since Nov 2009) and will flush the MDS session changes. ATG will invoke NavMenuUpdateMetadataObjectNS.fix() static method in NavMenuCustomPageBean.processSaveAction(). public void processSaveAction() { ..... ..... MDSSession mdsSession = mdsInstance.createSession(sessionOptions, null); MetadataObject menuMO = null; try { // bug 13642823 - should always use the same handle to the object menuMO = mdsSession.getMetadataObject(navigationMenuSource); // ------------------------ // NOTE : Call NavMenuUpdateMetadataObjectNS.fix() here boolean fixed = NavMenuUpdateMetadataObjectNS.fix(mdsSession, menuMO, NS); if ( fixed ) { // There were one or more bad customization instructions in the // tip-layer customization document. Those bad customization // instructions are now fixed and MDS session changes are flushed. // DO additional processing ( if any, such as log update) here. Or // you can skip this "if" statement. } // ------------------------ menuMO = mdsSession.getMutableMO(menuMO.getReference(), ccList, null); ...... NOTE : 1. For a given customization config, this NavMenuUpdateMetadataObjectNS.fix() static method uses Persistence-Layer API(s) to directly modify tip-layer customization document of a MO. Precautions should be taken to ensure there are NO existing mutable MO using same customization config, that are already fetched and/or updated within the same MDS session. 2. This NavMenuUpdateMetadataObjectNS.fix() static method will only work assuming that the missing namespace is in the current tip customization document. This method will NOT fix the missing namespaces present in non-tip layer(s) or in base document. In the case of ATG, since there is only one customization layer, this limitation should NOT be an issue.

Method Detail

fix

public static boolean fix(oracle.mds.core.MDSSession mdsSession,
                          oracle.mds.core.MetadataObject mo,
                          java.lang.String missingNS)
                   throws oracle.mds.naming.InvalidReferenceException,
                          oracle.mds.naming.InvalidReferenceTypeException,
                          oracle.mds.persistence.MDSIOException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                          oracle.mds.persistence.ConcurrentDocChangeException,
                          oracle.mds.exception.UnsupportedUpdateException,
                          oracle.mds.core.ConcurrentMOChangeException,
                          oracle.mds.core.ValidationException
This method will fix invalid insert customization instructions (if present) in the existing customization documents, will flush the MDS session changes and return true. If there weren't any invalid customization instructions, NO changes will be done to existing tip-layer customization document and this method will return false.

Parameters:
mdsSession - MDS Session.
mo - Read-only metadataobject to retrieve MOReference of base document and DocumentName of tip-layer customization document.
missingNS - ATG will send namespace - "http://myfaces.apache.org/trinidad/menu" for this parameter.
Returns:
true if any invalid customization instructions are fixed and the changes will be flushed to underlying MDS repository Or false if there aren't any invalid customization instructions.
Throws:
oracle.mds.naming.InvalidReferenceException
oracle.mds.naming.InvalidReferenceTypeException
oracle.mds.persistence.MDSIOException
java.io.IOException
org.xml.sax.SAXException
oracle.mds.persistence.ConcurrentDocChangeException
oracle.mds.exception.UnsupportedUpdateException
oracle.mds.core.ConcurrentMOChangeException
oracle.mds.core.ValidationException
